subs.text: September 9

@greengart I struggle to grasp how sensitive the receivers in the sky must be. I assume there's also some serious code magic, such as each character uses 2x or 3x the normal number of bits. Phone must also give a serious (!) signal boost vs. a standard SMS etc. message.
subs.rawText: @greengart I struggle to grasp how sensitive the receivers in the sky must be. I assume there's also some serious code magic, such as each character uses 2x or 3x the normal number of bits. Phone must also give a serious (!) signal boost vs. a standard SMS etc. message.

subs.text:
Can we all agree: With "Dynamic Island" on Apple iPhone, Android is toast.  The talking heads have decided this is as big or bigger (!!) than the launch of the original iPhone.

Short Google. It's going DOWN. My Pixel 6 resale value is now likely $0.00  Sad!

@a2brute Google Plus was a great idea. Having said that, Google (I think) dodged a bullet by shutting G+ down before the drama around Facebook. Social networks are fraught. 

I do follow one @MeWe group (Phone Show Chat, with @stevelitchfield & @tedsalmonuk ) MeWe is okay, I guess.

subs.text:
Data point: one Apple store sees almost 2:1 iPhone SE (current gen) sales vs. other models. Price is overwhelmingly important to walk-in buyers.

Google will sell a lot of Pixel 6a for the same reason. It is missing Qi charging but is otherwise a superior low cost GOOD phone.

subs.text:
Solid (if critical) overview of Mastodon, a  decentralized social network. It has promise, but also significant frustrations. The biggest downside: Mastodon's user base is TINY compared with Twitter or Facebook. If you care, I'm @ronkjeffries@mastodon.social
hat tip: @davewiner
